Then he said to me: 'Allah' is among His Names, so whoever says they are created has claimed that Allah is created. And he began to emphasize the gravity of their affair and declare them disbelievers. He recited: {Allah is your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers} and mentioned another verse. I said: Whoever says Allah existed but His Knowledge did not? His face changed at all of this, and he was most changed and angry at this. Then he said to me: A disbeliever. And he said: Every day I increase in insight regarding these people.
15 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Abu Abdullah say: Shu'bah said: Qatadah did not meet Abu Rafi'; he only wrote from Khilas from him. And I heard him say: Indeed Qatadah did not hear from Mu'adhah.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
16 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: My strongest assumption is that Abu Abdullah mentioned Abdullah bin Raja', so he declared him trustworthy and favored him. I said: What is his story? He said: He was [good], then he made mistakes and had delusions. He narrated a hadith one day, and it was said to him: You erred in it. So he said: Allah's help is sought regarding our errors in other things as well, or [he admitted] we have erred. Abu Abdullah said to me: So if the Sheikh admits this, know that he is safe. And perhaps something comes out of a person, and the heart testifies to his truthfulness.
17 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I asked him about the two sons of Buraidah. He said: Sulaiman is sweeter to the heart, and it is as if he is the more sound of the two in Hadith. And Abdullah has things that it is as if we denounce them due to their beauty, and he is acceptable (Ja'iz) in Hadith.
18 - And Al-Furat bin Al-Sa'ib is close to Muhammad bin Ziyad

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
Al-Tahhan regarding Maimun; he is accused of what that one is accused of.
19 - And Al-Furat bin Salman is trustworthy (Thiqah), truthful (Saduq).
20 - And Abu Al-Malih is trustworthy, precise (Dabit) in his hadith, truthful. And to me, he is more precise than Ja'far bin Burqan. And Ja'far bin Burqan is trustworthy, precise in the hadith of Maimun and the hadith of Burayd bin Al-Asam, but regarding the hadith of Al-Zuhri, he is agitated and inconsistent in it.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
21 - And Asim bin Kulaib is trustworthy.
22 - And Asim bin Bahdalah is trustworthy. He mentioned him with Quran, righteousness, and virtue, and [said] he is Salih al-Hadith (good in Hadith). Al-A'mash is greater than him among the Kufans.
23 - And Asim Al-Ahwal is among the Huffaz (preservers) of Hadith, trustworthy.
24 - And he said: Abdul-Wahhab is weak in Hadith, agitated.
25 - And Ja'far bin Muhammad bin Ali bin Husain is trustworthy, strong in Hadith.
26 - And his father, Abu Ja'far Muhammad bin Ali bin Husain, is trustworthy, strong in Hadith.
27 - And Mujalid, from Al-Sha'bi and others, is weak in Hadith.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
28 - And Zakariya, from Al-Sha'bi and others, is good (Jayyid) in Hadith, trustworthy.
29 - And Alqamah bin Marthad used to be accused of Irja', and he was trustworthy in his hadith, precise.
30 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Abu Abdullah said to me: When Ibn Mahdi mentioned Hammad bin Zaid, he would say: Our Sheikh, and our Sheikh was firm in the Sunnah. Abu Abdullah said: And he did not have a book; his hadith was all from memory.
31 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: And I heard Abu Abdullah say: Jarir said regarding the hadith of Al-A'mash: We used to stick them [together]

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
32 - He said: Sulaiman bin Abi Muslim Al-Ahwal is trustworthy, good in Hadith, and Ibn Uyainah narrated from him.
33 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: He told me: And Yahya and Abdul-Rahman used not to narrate anything from Jabir Al-Ju'fi. Abu Abdullah said: And Jabir was deserving of that.
34 - He said: And Abu Al-Za'ra' is more pleasing to me in Hadith than Abu Sufyan Talhah bin Nafi'.
35 - And he said to me: Al-Aswad bin Shaiban is among the best of Allah's servants. He used to say when they gathered at his place: As for me, I have a need, I want to pray. He said: You know that there was no showing off in his heart.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
36 - He said: And Malik was among the most established of people, yet he used to make mistakes.
37 - Abu Abdullah said: Al-Mas'udi is Salih al-Hadith (good in Hadith), and whoever took from him early on, then his taking is sound.
38 - And I asked him about Uqayl. He said: Salih al-Hadith; his narration is like the narration of his companions, there is no harm in him.
39 - Ali bin Abi Talhah has denounced things (Manakir), and he is a man from the people of Homs.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
40 - Ali bin Al-Mubarak, there is no harm in his hadith.
41 - Sulaiman bin Bilal is Salih al-Hadith.
42 - Sharik bin Abi Namir is Salih al-Hadith.
43 - Al-Zubayr bin Abdullah from Ja'far bin Mus'ab: We do not know either of them.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
44 - Al-Miqdam bin Shuraih is trustworthy.
45 - Isra'il is Salih al-Hadith.
46 - And Ash'ath bin Abi Al-Sha'tha' - he is Ibn Sulaym Al-Muharibi, and his father is a man from the companions of Abdullah - is Salih al-Hadith.
47 - Abu Atiyah is trustworthy.
48 - Ibn Al-Asbahani is Salih al-Hadith.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
49 - Mujahid bin Wardan has very little [material].
50 - Abu Al-Rijal, the companion of Amrah, is Salih al-Hadith.
51 - Muhammad bin Abdul-Rahman bin Zurarah is Salih al-Hadith.
52 - Salim Al-Dawsi, I do not know [him].
53 - Muawiyah bin Salih, I know nothing but good [about him].
54 - Habib Al-Mu'allim is trustworthy.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
55 - Abu Al-Muhazzim Yazid: As for Shu'bah, he did not narrate from him, but Hammad bin Salamah narrates from him.
56 - And Abu Bakr bin Hafs is trustworthy.
57 - And Ibrahim bin Maimun, we do not know him.
58 - Talhah bin Yahya is Salih al-Hadith.
59 - Yazid bin Ibrahim is trustworthy.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
60 - Mughirah bin Ziyad, I do not know.
61 - And Usamah bin Zaid, the general populace is upon him; they have narrated from him, except that Yahya bin Sa'id abandoned him.
62 - Ibrahim bin Al-Fadl, I do not know.
63 - Dawud Al-Awdi is weak.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
64 - Imran bin Hudair is trustworthy.
65 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: And I heard him say: I have not seen anyone more knowledgeable than Yahya bin Sa'id - meaning regarding the rituals (Manasik).
66 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I asked Khalaf: Did anyone refrain from Jabir Al-Ju'fi? He said: I do not know [anyone who did]. Sufyan bin Uyainah was among those strongest in speech regarding him, yet he narrated from him. He only had three hadiths. I said: Is anything authentic from him that he believes in the Return (Raj'ah)? He said: No, but he was from the Shia of Ali. And Shu'bah, Al-Thawri, and the people narrate from him, except that these people do not narrate from him those things in which he combines Al-Qasim, Salim, and a group like this, seven or eight [chains]. For what would he narrate these things from him?
67 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Harun bin Ma'ruf say: I heard Abdullah bin Wahb say: Abdul-Rahman bin Mahdi said to me: Write for me from the hadiths of Amr. So I wrote two hundred hadiths for him, and I narrated them to him.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
68 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I said to Yahya bin Ma'in: The hadiths from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, regarding the dislike of Cupping (Hijama) for the fasting person, how is the source through which they were reported? He said: They are all good (Jiyad). We said: From what they say, [they are] agitated (Mudtarib)? He said: I do not say that these hadiths are agitated.
69 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Yahya say: Muhammad bin Ishaq...
70 - We asked him about Abdul-Rahman bin Ishaq. He said: The Kufan is weak.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
71 - And Abdul-Rahman bin Ishaq Al-Basri, who narrates from Al-Zuhri, there is no harm in him.
72 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I said to Abu Zakariya Yahya: Ismail bin Zakariya from Al-A'mash from Habib bin Abi Thabit from Sa'id bin Jubayr from Ibn Umar and Ibn Abbas, they both said: If a man swears off his wife (Ayla) and four months pass, it is an irrevocable divorce (Talqah Ba'inah). I said: Is the contrary narrated from them? He said: Yes, Sufyan and Shu'bah both narrate the contrary, or [he said] this hadith is a mistake. I said: From whom did it come? He said: Ismail bin Zakariya, he is weak in Hadith. I said: So did it come from him? He said: No, it is famous from Al-A'mash. I said: So did it come from Al-A'mash? He said: Yes, that is what I think, that it came from Al-A'mash.
73 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Layth bin Abi Sulaim was mentioned, he said:

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
Weak in Hadith from Tawus. And if he combines Tawus and others [adding] an addition, he is weak.
74 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Abu Abdullah Ahmad bin Hanbal say: Marwan bin Shuja' told us. Abu Abdullah said: A truthful Sheikh.
75 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Al-Hisni told us, he said: Ma'qil told us, he said: I came to Muhammad bin Ishaq and heard him speaking about Qadar (freewill/predestination heresy), so I never returned to him.
76 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard him say: Mudrik bin Umarah is a known man. And another man named Mudrik was mentioned, he said: He is not known.
77 - He said: They asked him about the hearing of Abu Salamah from his father. So I heard him

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
say: His father died while he was small. Abu Salamah was one of the youngest of them. Then he said: There is no one among the people [who narrates] more than Abu Salamah. I said: In the quantity of narration? He said: In the quantity of what he narrates, and he sat with Ibn Abbas, and the status of Abu Salamah was great on that day.
78 - I heard Al-Maymuni say: Ahmad bin Hanbal was asked: Narrate to us the hadith of Abdul-Qais from Al-Qati'i? So he said: Ask some of the scholars of Gharib (strange/uncommon words), for I dislike speaking about the saying of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, based on conjecture and then making a mistake.
79 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: And Abu Abdullah mentioned Za'idah, so he prioritized him and favored him in verification and precision.
80 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: They asked him: Who narrated most regarding Ayyub? He said: In my view, no one is more knowledgeable about his hadith than Hammad - meaning Ibn Zaid - and he erred in several things.
81 - I heard Al-Maymuni say: And it is correct to me that he did not attend

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
[the funeral of] Abu Nasr Al-Tammar when he died. So I assumed that was due to what he had answered during the Inquisition.
82 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard Ahmad bin Hanbal, and he was asked about the hadith of Abu Qais Al-Awdi regarding what he narrated from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he wiped over the sandals and the socks. So he said to me:

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text: It is known from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, that he wiped over the Khuffs (leather socks). This matter is not [sound]. I mean Qais, that he has denounced things (Manakir).

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
83 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Yahya told us, he said: Zuhair [said]: I saw Ash'ath bin Sawar standing at Abu Al-Zubayr's place, with people between them, and Abu Al-Zubayr was narrating. So Ash'ath would say: How did he say? And what did he say?
84 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Affan told us, he said: Mu'adh told us, he said: Ash'ath said: I never saw Hisham - meaning Ibn Hassan - with Al-Hasan ever. So it was said to him: Indeed Amr says this, so if you say it, you strengthen him against him, [even] if he told the truth or something like this. He said: I will not say this, and I will not return to this.
85 - He said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Affan told us, Mu'adh told us, he said: Humaid Al-Batty said: If people come to you, one matter carries them? No, but take

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
from this one and that one, so reconcile between them. He said: So Al-Batty said: I cannot bear your magic. And Humaid was a reconciler/reformer - look at Al-Basr[a].
86 - He said: And Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Affan told us, he said: Yahya bin Sa'id told me, he said: I used to ask Humaid about something from the Fatwa of Al-Hasan, and he would say: I have forgotten.
87 - He said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Ismail told us, he said: Abu Raja' told us, he said: I said to Al-Hasan: When was your time in Medina? He said: The nights of Siffin. He said: I said: So when did you move? He said: A year after Siffin.
88 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I heard him - and he mentioned Abdul-Warith - so he said: He was older than Ismail bin Ulayyah by two years, and he heard from more than one person

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
Ismail did not hear from him. Then he mentioned the precision of Abdul-Warith and that he was a master of grammar. Then he said: And he erred in several things. Then he said: He narrated hadiths from Ayyub that none of his companions narrated, yet despite this, to him [Ahmad], he is firm (Thabt) and precise (Dabit).
89 - He said: And I heard Abu Abdullah Ahmad bin Hanbal say: Faith is speech and action, it increases and decreases. They said to him: And intention? He said: Intention is a prerequisite in this place.
90 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Yahya - meaning Ibn Ayyub - told us, he said: I heard Humaid Al-Ru'asi say: Zuhair, when he heard a hadith from a narrator, would write upon it: "I have finished."
91 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Yahya told us, he said: I heard Shu'aib bin Harb, and a hadith from Zuhair and Shu'bah was mentioned, so Shu'bah was mentioned to him [as superior], so he said:

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
Zuhair is more memorizing than twenty like Shu'bah. Yahya said: He said: I heard Mu'adh bin Mu'adh say: No, by Allah, Sufyan was not more established to me than Zuhair. Yahya said: He said: I heard Mu'adh bin Mu'adh say: If I heard the hadith from Zuhair, I did not mind if I did not hear it from Sufyan.
92 - He said: Yahya told us, he said: I heard Aswad bin Salim say: I heard Hushaim say: We used to leave the sitting of Shu'bah because he used to involve us in backbiting.
93 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: And Abu Abdullah said to me one day: O Abu Al-Hasan, indeed I liken the piety of your grandfather Maimun to the piety of Ibn Sirin.
94 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: I asked Abu Abdullah about Aflah bin Humaid. He said: Good/Acceptable, he is tolerable.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
95 - I said: Salamah bin Wardan? He said to me: The one who narrates from Anas? I do not know what his hadith is; he has denounced things.
96 - I said: Dawud bin Qais Al-Farra'? He said: Good in Hadith.
97 - I said: Muhammad bin Abdullah, the nephew of Al-Zuhri? He said: Tolerable also.
98 - I said: Usamah bin Zaid narrates from Al-Qasim? He said: And this one also, people tolerate him, except that Yahya Al-Qattan abandoned him.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
99 - Abdul-Rahman bin Abi Al-Mawwal? He said: I do not see any harm in his hadith; he is among those who are tolerated.
100 - I said: Fayid, the freed slave of Ubaidullah? He said: This is the one whose hadith people abandoned. Abu Al-Warqa', he is called the companion of Ibn Abi Awfa.
101 - I said: Hisham bin Sa'd Al-Khashab? He said: He is a man who is tolerated.
102 - I said: Isa bin Asim? He said: Trustworthy.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
103 - I said: Sa'id bin Muslim bin Banak? He said: I also see no harm in him.
104 - I said: Ibrahim bin Abdullah bin Al-Harith Al-Jumahi? He said: I find myself knowing this one.
105 - I said: Sulaiman bin Abi Khalid narrates from his father? He said: I do not know him.
106 - I asked him about Umar bin Nabih Al-Ka'bi. He said: There is no harm in him.
107 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Abu Abdullah said: Husain bin Waqid has denounced things.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
108 - I asked him about Abdullah bin Sa'id bin Abi Hind, so he said: Trustworthy.
109 - I asked him about Dawud bin Bakr bin Abi Al-Furat, so he said: I do not know him.
110 - And I asked him about Abdullah bin Amir Al-Aslami who narrates from Abu Al-Zubayr. He said: He is not strong in Hadith.
111 - And I asked him about Nafi' bin Jubayr bin Mut'im, so he said to me: A man from the sons of the Companions, trustworthy; we know nothing but good.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
112 - And I asked him about Muhammad bin Amr [narrating] from Abu Salamah. So he said to me: Perhaps he raised some hadith, and perhaps he stopped it. And he is tolerable. And Yahya bin Sa'id is more established in Hadith than him.
113 - And I asked him about Abdullah bin Dinar from Ibn Umar. So he said to me: Trustworthy, except one hadith he narrates from Ibn Umar, he said: "Loyalty is not sold nor gifted." And Nafi' said in the story of Barirah: "Loyalty belongs to the one who liberated."

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
114 - And I asked him about Kulaib bin Wa'il who narrates from Ibn Umar. He said: I see no harm in him.
115 - I asked him about Amr bin Dinar regarding Ibn Abbas and Ibn Umar. He said: Among the trustworthy ones. It is reported from Shu'bah that he said: I have not seen anyone more established than Amr bin Dinar. I said: He has things he sends (Mursal)? He said: If he says "I heard" or "He told us." And he used to narrate things from a man from Ibn Abbas.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
116 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: And I heard Abu Abdullah say: Abdullah bin Zaid bin Aslam is more established than Abdul-Rahman. I said: So Abdul-Rahman? He said: So-so; he is not like him. And he weakened his status a little.
117 - He said: And I heard Abu Abdullah say: Mahdi is trustworthy. I said: Mahdi bin Maimun? He said: Yes, trustworthy.
118 - He said: And I heard him say: Abdullah bin Wahb Al-Misri was a righteous man. What [great] Hadith he possessed! I saw him.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
What [a man]! And he praised him. And Abu Abdullah mentioned his leniency in taking [Hadith methods]. I said to him: Is it like his Egyptian companions or the generality of his companions in leniency in taking? He said to me: Yes.
119 - And I heard him say: Bishr bin Rafi', I do not see him as strong in Hadith.
120 - And I heard him say: Haywah bin Shuraih is a righteous man, he has beautiful things. And he increased the praise of Ibn Al-Mubarak regarding him: "No one was described [to me] except that I saw him to be less than what was described, except Haywah, for I saw him and he fulfilled what was described to me."
121 - I asked him about Abu Abdullah Al-Shaqri. He said: He is not strong to me; he is weak.

book_title: From the Speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal on Hadith Defects and Knowledge of Men
text:
122 - And he mentioned Al-Walid bin Muslim, so he said: He was a man of leniency.
123 - Al-Maymuni told us, he said: Khalid bin Khidash told us: Al-Darawardi, Ma'n, and the generality of the people of Medina said to me: Do not narrate from Abdul-Rahman bin Zaid bin Aslam, for he does not know what he is saying. But stick to Abdullah bin Zaid.
124 - I asked him about Ata' Al-Sulaimi, so he said to me: This is one of the best of Allah's servants. He has no Hadith; it is only his opinion and his speech.
125 - And Salm Al-Alawi, he said: I knew nothing but good, but Shu'bah spoke against him. I said: Because of the story of the new moon? He said to me: Yes.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 126 - I said: So Al-Rabi' bin Sabih? He said to me: regarding his conduct, he is a righteous man, but he does not possess Hadith that is needed; it is as if he weakened his status. 127 - I said: Hammad bin Abi Sulaiman? He said: As for the hadiths of these trustworthy ones (Thiqat) from him—Shu'bah, Sufyan, and Hisham—they are close [acceptable] hadiths. However, he was the first to speak about Opinion (Ra'y). I said: Did he hold the view of Irja'? He said to me: Yes, he held the view of Irja'. 128 - I said: Jabir Al-Ju'fi? He said to me: He held the view of Tashayyu' (Shi'ism). I said: Is he accused of lying in his Hadith? He said to me: Whoever attacked him only attacked him due to the fear of lying. I said: Lying? He said: Yes, by Allah, and that is evident in his Hadith when you look at it. 129 - I said: Hanzalah bin Abi Sufyan? He said to me: Trustworthy (Thiqah), Trustworthy. The Jumahi.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 130 - I said: So Hanzalah Al-Sadusi? He said: He has Munkar (denounced) things. He narrated two hadiths, both of which are Munkar from the Prophet (peace be upon him) via Anas: that the Prophet (peace be upon him) performed Qunut in Witr, and the other: 'He commanded us that when we meet, one should shake hands with his companion, and that we should bow to one another, and embrace one another.' Both are Munkar. 131 - I said: Yusuf Al-Majishun? He said to me: There is no harm in him, and we caught up with him. I said: You narrated from him, and he narrates from his father? He said: Yes. I said: What about his father? He said: There is no harm in him.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 132 - He mentioned Abd al-Aziz and said: He is the cousin of Yusuf. He mentioned good about him too. My greatest knowledge and understanding is that he mentioned a brother of Yusuf called Abd Allah, and he mentioned good about him as well. 133 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: And he said—meaning Ahmad bin Hanbal—and he said to me: Yusuf lived a long life, so I met him with a Juz' (a small volume). 134 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Abu Abd Allah said to me: Uthman bin Hakim is a Sheikh. I said: His hadiths? He said: They are close (Muqaribah). 135 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: He mentioned things from Mujalid, from Al-Sha'bi. He said: How many wonders [oddities] Mujalid has! 136 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: We discussed something they differed on one day...

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: ...So a man said: Ibn Abi Shaybah says, from Affan. Abu Abd Allah said: Leave Ibn Abi Shaybah out of this; look at what others say. Abu Abd Allah meant his frequent mistakes. 137 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I said: Ismail bin Zakariyya, how is he? He said to me: As for the famous hadiths he narrates, he is close (Muqarib) in them, his Hadith is Salih (good), but the heart is not open to him; he is not known like this in the era of seeking [knowledge]. 138 - I said to Abu Abd Allah: Al-Rabi' bin Sabih? He said: He does not have much that strengthens him. He has things he narrates from Ata' and Al-Hasan, [regarding] issues, and there is no harm in him. I said: A thing he narrates from Yazid? He said to me: He narrates it from Yazid from Anas regarding Raising [hands/voice or elevating hadith]? I said: Yes. Abu Abd Allah smiled at me. I said: Do you remember it? Which one is it? Is it Yazid Al-Raqashi? He said to me: Yes. I said: And this Yazid is weak? He said: Yes, he is weak.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 139 - Abu Abd Allah mentioned the hadith of Rawh from Ibn Abi Humaid. He said: If only it were someone other than Ibn Abi Humaid. 140 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard Abu Al-Walid Hisham bin Abd Al-Malik say: Malik bin Anas had a bad opinion of Ibn Ishaq. 141 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Abu Abd Allah said: Ibn Jurayj was one of the vessels of knowledge.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 142 - Abu Abd Allah said, and he mentioned Shu'aib Al-Jubba'i: A man who read books and resembled Wahb. 143 - Abu Abd Allah said: Rishdin, there is no harm in him regarding hadiths of Raqa'iq (heart-softeners). 144 - He said: Ahmad bin Hanbal said: Ziyad bin Jubair bin Hayyah is a known man. 145 - He said: I do not know anyone who narrated from Abu Isa Al-Aswari other than Qatadah.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 146 - He said: And the statement of Ibn Hanbal: We do not find anyone who raises [marfu' attribution] other than Zuhair, meaning regarding the Muhrim (pilgrim) if he does not find sandals. Zuhair was one of the mines of knowledge. 147 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Abu Abd Allah said to me regarding Yahya bin Sa'id in the hadith of Shu'bah: It is nothing. From Mujahid, he said: I heard Aisha. He denied that he heard from Aisha.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 148 - He said: Abu Abd Allah said: Ibn Abi Arubah did not hear from Yahya bin Sa'id, nor did Ma'mar hear anything from Yahya. Abu Abd Allah said that. 149 - I heard him say: Bilal bin Sa'd is a righteous man. 150 - He said: And I heard Abu Abd Allah say: Muhammad bin Abd al-Rahman bin Ghunj is a Sheikh, close (Muqarib) in Hadith; Al-Layth narrates from him. 151 - He said: And Abu Abd Allah mentioned Al-Sari bin Ismail, so he said: People abandoned his Hadith. 152 - And Al-Mas'udi: whoever heard from him at the end, then their hearing from him is criticized.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 153 - A man asked him about Al-Hajjaj bin Artah: What is his status? He said: His status is that he adds to the hadiths. Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard Abu Abd Allah say: Perhaps I saw Al-Hajjaj placing his hand on his head saying: The love of honor has killed me. 154 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: He said: Ibn Abi Laila was mentioned to Abu Abd Allah. He said: Weak. And Al-Hajjaj is greater in my soul [estimation] than him, except that he—meaning Ibn Abi Laila—in his hadith from Al-Minhal, it is as if he... 155 - A man said to him: Where does Mujalid stand compared to them? He said: This one raises much dust [is very turbulent].

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 156 - Abu Abd Allah said: So I wondered at him in that situation, how he used to answer him in such matters. Then he said to us: But he was a man who looked much into the narrators (Rijal) and speech (Kalam). Abu Abd Allah only mentioned Ibn Al-Mubarak in this story because he disliked answering them, but they informed him of the reward he would have in knowing this, so Ibn Al-Mubarak was mentioned at that time. 157 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: Sa'id bin Bashir, I saw him weakening his status. I said: The one who narrates from Qatadah? He said: He narrated things from Qatadah. 158 - Muhammad bin Salamah Al-Harrani. He said: He is [strong] in his body, and I think he said: There is no harm in his Hadith. 159 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him say: Ibn Abi Najih is Trustworthy (Thiqah), and his father was among the best of Allah's worshippers.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 160 - Kathir bin Jamhan. He said: I do not know Kathir. 161 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him say: Nothing is authentic for Hushaim from Al-Zuhri except four hadiths. 162 - And Ali bin Salih is Salih (good) in Hadith, but Al-Hasan bin Salih is his brother. 163 - Al-Maimuni told us, Ahmad told us, he said: Waki' told us, he said: Sa'id bin Al-Sa'ib is Hasan (good) in Hadith.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 164 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him say: Ibn Abi Labid is Established (Thabt) in Hadith. 165 - And Rabi'ah bin Abi Abd al-Rahman is Trustworthy (Thiqah). 166 - He said: I heard him say regarding Ghassan bin Mudar: How difficult [strict] of a Sheikh he was! 167 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: He said: We have not seen anyone more established in [narrating from] Ata' than Amr and Ibn Jurayj.

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 168 - He said: Ibn Hanbal told us, he said: Yahya told us, Muthanna told us, he said: Qatadah told us. Muthanna is Trustworthy (Thiqah). 169 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him say: Abu Al-Zinad is among the Companions of Hadith. 170 - And Ibn Ajlan is Trustworthy (Thiqah). 171 - And his father is Salih (good) in Hadith; he met Abu Hurairah. 172 - I heard him say: Umarah bin Al-Qa'qa' is Trustworthy (Thiqah).

book_title: From the speech of Ahmad bin Hanbal regarding the defects of Hadith and knowledge of men
text: 173 - And Ishaq bin Suwaid is Established (Thabt). 174 - Al-Maimuni told us, he said: I heard him say, mentioning the Levantines (Shamiyyin): Sadaqah bin Khalid is Trustworthy (Thiqah), Trusted (Ma'mun). It has not reached me that any of the Levantines writes his hadith with his own hand other than him; that is evident in his Hadith. 175 - And he mentioned Sadaqah Al-Samin, so he said: Weak. 176 - We discussed Salih bin Kaysan. I said to him: How is he? He said: Salih (Good/Righteous). 177 - I heard him say: Amr bin Ubaid was not worthy that one narrates from him. [Ended] to here from Al-Maimuni.
